result.execSummary:
The defendant Brianna N Pacetti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or school.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
No contact with any victims or co-actor or the business.
Provide DNA sample if not already done.

Restitution to be determined on 8/31/2016 at 2pm. To be joint and severally.

AS OF 1/09/17: Restitution added for $17,802.03 to LaBelle Company, paid joint and several with 15CF1367-Tyler Lewein. (along with all surcharges)

If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

dated 8/9/16 filed by DCO requesting clarification of the probationary term ordered for Count 2.
Restitution hearing on August 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Brianna N Pacetti in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for sentencing. Court imposed the following sentence:

  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

 

3 YEARS and 2 MONTHS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  14 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  24 MONTHS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

TERM OF PROBATION:  3 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
*No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
*Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
*Inform Agent of all prescriptions
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No contact with any victims or co-actor or the business
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
RESTITUTION:  $to be determined and to be joint and severally

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

CONDITION TIME:  9 months. 1st 3 months straight time and the last 6 months with huber for treatment and work
Sentence to commence 07/01/2016 by 6 pm. 

EXPUNGEMENT IS DENIED

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.  Restitution hearing scheduled for August 31, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
dated 6/27/16 filed by Attorney Jones with character letters.

with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Brianna N Pacetti in court with attorney Thomas R. Jones.  

State moves to orally amend the charge from a Class G Felony to a Class I Felony of 943.20(3)(bf).
Defense has no objections.
Court orders the State file an amended Information within 48 hours.
Victims M.P. & G.K. presented a statement to the court.

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to the charge.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of the charge.

Matter set over for sentencing.
